      • SerCtlStartBreak

        public static final int SerCtlStartBreak
        These are additional settings which are used with the SerControl function. It has the prototype: 
        
 SerControl(int refNum, int op, Object valueP, ShortHolder valueLenP)
 and
 SerControl(int refNum, int op, int valueP, int valueLenP) // used for null valueP andvalueLenP
        You call it like: 
        
 int flag = 
 ShortHolder valueLenP = new ShortHolder(0);
 int err = Palm.SerControl (iRefNum, flag, null, null);
        Using one of the next values:
        turn RS232 break signal on: users are responsible for ensuring that the break is set long enough to genearate a valie BREAK! valueP = 0, valueLenP = 0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SerCtlHandshakeThreshold

        public static final int SerCtlHandshakeThreshold

      • SerCtlEmuSetBlockingHook

        public static final int SerCtlEmuSetBlockingHook
        Set a blocking hook routine FOR EMULATION MODE ONLY - NOT SUPPORTED ON THE PALM.
        valueP = MemPtr to SerCallbackEntryType, *valueLenP = sizeof(SerCallbackEntryType)
        RETURNS: the old settings in the first argument
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • baudRate

        public int baudRate

      • flags

        public int flags
        Value of ORing the FlagXXXX values defined in this class together

      • ctsTimeout

        public int ctsTimeout
        The timeout for the Clear To Send line when transmitting, in terms of Palm ticks. (100 ticks per second). This is only valid if FlagCTSAutoM is set.
